elements.title: ice XVII (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ice XVII (structure shown) potentially has a use in green technology as a medium for storing hydrogen?

elements.title: Working from Within (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the book Working from Within details how W. V. Quine only began to use the term "naturalism" years after he had already developed the key tenets of the philosophy?

elements.title: a Louisiana radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the owner of a Louisiana radio station was killed while in the process of putting it back on the air?

elements.title: Story of a Secret State (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1944 Story of a Secret State was one of the first book accounts of the German occupation of Poland, including the Holocaust in Poland?

elements.title: Dimension 68000 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Dimension 68000 microcomputer had expansion cards to emulate the Apple II, the IBM PC, and various CP/M machines?

elements.title: William Penney, Baron Penney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Penney, Baron Penney, was credited as the "father of the British bomb"?

elements.title: Sonny with a Chance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the proposed third season of teen sitcom Sonny with a Chance was reworked into the sketch comedy series So Random! after the departure of its lead actor Demi Lovato?

elements.title: Hermann Marx (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that banker Hermann Marx and his firm underwrote the share issue that led to the "pepper scandal" of 1934?
